text.section: The Agricultural Development Board is created as a political subdivision of the Commonwealth to perform essential governmental and public functions by administering funds to provide economic assistance to the agriculture community of the Commonwealth. The board shall be a public agency within the meaning of KRS 61.805, 61.870, and other applicable statutes.
The members appointed under subsection (2)(b)2. and 3. of this section shall be chosen from a list of three (3) nominees submitted to the Governor by each of the respective organizations.
Consideration shall be given to racial and gender equity in the appointment of board members.
The majority of the voting members shall be active farmers.
Members of the board shall be reimbursed for expenses incurred in the performance of their duties.
The Governor shall convene the first meeting of the board by August 1, 2000.
The board shall meet monthly, or at the call of the chair or a majority of the voting members.
A quorum of the board shall consist of nine (9) voting members. A majority of the voting members present may act upon matters before the board.
The board shall be attached to the Office of the Governor for administrative purposes.

law.history: Amended 2007 Ky. Acts ch. 137, sec. 182, effective June 26, 2007. -- Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 530, sec. 4, effective April 26, 2000.
